meanings.sent1: The wild horse was too restrainable to escape the pen.
meanings.sent2: The lock on the cage was easily restrainable by the zookeeper.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy thought he was restrainable, but he always found a way to wiggle free.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a restrainable river, bubbling up and then held back by a dam.
meanings.sent5: The idea of time travel was as restrainable as catching a shooting star.

meanings.definition: Able to be controlled or limited.
meanings.sent1: The volume on the TV was restrainable with the remote.
meanings.sent2: His temper was usually restrainable, but today it seemed to explode.
meanings.sent3: The urge to eat the entire cake was almost restrainable, but then she took one more bite.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the room was like a restrainable balloon, growing bigger and bigger.
meanings.sent5: The secret was as restrainable as a whisper in a crowded room.
